WizardAnswered on 08 Mar 2019The only way to use SRS for tax relief is to deposit cash into your SRS account.If you have maxed out all other avenues of efficient tax relief, then SRS can be an alternative.There is still a limit to SRS contribution.When you decide to start withdrawing from SRS, you get subjected to enjoy 50% discount on income tax applied to the withdrawn amount.https://www.iras.gov.sg/irashome/Individuals/Locals/Working-Out-Your-Taxes/Special-tax-schemes/Supplementary-Retirement-Scheme--SRS-/Tax-on-SRS-withdrawal/Withdraw 20k a year, you will be in the lowest income tax bracket0 comments0
